moves.1. Nf3: once again a lot of fun with a very offensive game due to many mistakes by my opponent. I annotate it because I like to replay the few funny traps I made here. Once again the game has no value in se, but just for the fun of it.
moves.2. d4 d5 3. Bf4 Nc6 4. e3 h5: well, once again, i guess bluemarble "tries" strange stuff to disturb me
moves.5. c4 Bg4 6. Nc3: "I don't care" and i play my moves...
moves.6... dxc4 7. Bxc4 Nf6: all my pieces are now developed, my king is about to castle anytime and black is not exactly coordinated. e5 is not an option to open the game... I don't see anything for them, and I will restrict him other possibilities
moves.8. h3 Bxf3: chooses to drop his most active piece
moves.9. Qxf3 e6 10. O-O: i feel very comfortable. Even my queen is not too badly placed.
moves.10... Bd6 11. Bg5: i don't mean to offer him the possibility to equal again like in the first game where I made a stupide mistake after having gained a pawn.
moves.11... Qd7: once again, bluemarble gives me a pawn... best was to come back with bishop on e7
moves.13... Rg8: of course this rook is not really comfortable. And the h5 pawn is too well exposed. I have a few targets here. On the other side, I have to be careful for eventual traps on h3 and g2
moves.15. Qh8+: that is why: if he moves the king, I take the rook. I cautiously calculated that there is no danger for my king to let my queen in a8 in case i have to go there.
moves.15... Bf8: but he thinks he has a better defense.
moves.17... Be7 18. Qh8+: again? I am pointing to the h5 pawn, now
moves.19... O-O-O: looks like THE move to try something -though it is obviously over here
moves.20. Rfc1: let us find some other targets
moves.21... f6: he may have thought i was pointing the pawn: i didn't event see it
moves.22. Bxa6: and here is the trap of course. We are now two on the knight and the b7 pawn is pinned
moves.22... Rg8: open the fire for his own trap that will never come to end
moves.23. Qxc6: because we are going to exchange now...
moves.23... Qxc6 24. Rxc6 bxa6: all of this for... one more pawn...
moves.25... Kd7 26. Rxa6: well, no, three pawns (though this last one was not in my mind)
moves.30... Rb6: ?? things get worse and worse for black by simplifying...
moves.31. Rxb6 cxb6 32. g4 fxg4 33. hxg4: it is now clear that nothing can stop all this stuff...
moves.33... Ke6: but bluemarble just likes to fight.
moves.34... Kd5 35. Rxb6 Bc7 36. Ra6 Ke4 37. K: may be my only mistake here: i could have played Re6+ to make it quicker
moves.41... Kg4 42. d8=Q Kf5 43. Qe7 Kg4 44. R: was he thinking about a mistake to get a draw?
